thread.title: Man arrested following death of Frank Sidebottom creator's son Harry Sievey as tributes pour in
thread.title_full: Man arrested following death of Frank Sidebottom creator's son Harry Sievey as tributes pour in

author: Alexandra Rucki
title: Man arrested following death of Frank Sidebottom creator's son Harry Sievey as tributes pour in
text:
News Man arrested following death of Frank Sidebottom creator's son as tributes pour in Harry Sievey, 24, died after his bicycle was involved in a crash with another biker and a blue Vaxuhall Corsa in Withington on Sunday night Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Frank Sidebottom's son plays Timperley Sunset Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A man has been arrested over the death of Frank Sidebottom creator Chris Sievey’s son in a road collision. 
Harry Sievey, 24, died after his bicycle was involved in a crash with another biker and a blue Vaxuhall Corsa in Withington on Sunday night. 
Police launched an investigation and a 61-year-old man has since been arrested on suspicion of causing death by dangerous driving. He was taken into police custody for questioning. 
Emergency services were first called to Mauldeth Road, at the junction of Wellington Road, at 10.15pm on Sunday, February 12. 
Harry was pronounced dead at the scene, while the other cyclist, aged in his 20s, was taken to hospital with minor injuries. Harry Sievey at the unveiling of his dad's statue Read More 
The bikes the men were riding were described as a blue Speedsta bike and a white Mango bike. 
Senior Investigating Officer Sgt Lee Westhead said: “We are currently investigating the full circumstances of this collision. 
“I would firstly like to offer my sincere condolences to the family of the young man who died and specially trained officers continue to offer them their support. 
“It is key we now try and establish exactly what happened and I would urge anyone who saw the collision to please call my team. 
“If you saw anything in the moments beforehand, or recognise the vehicle from earlier that day, then I would also ask you to contact us with any information.” Harry Sievey Cyclist, 24, dies following collision involving another biker and car 
Harry, who was a musician and worked at Manchester bar Cooper Hall, has been described by friends as a ‘beautiful creative ball of energy’. 
Dominick Marcus Allan posted on Facebook: “So shocked to hear Harry Sievey has passed away, very sad news RIP brother x.” 
Chelsea Monks wrote: “Rest in peace Harry Sievey. I will miss your craziness, your inability to keep a phone for more than a week and your love for Popolino’s. Love you mate.” 
Bob Cooper said: “Harry Sievey was the funniest person I’ve ever been lucky enough to know and every single song he touched was a pure banger. I’m totally in shock, thinking of your friends and family in Manchester on such a hard day.” Frank Sidebottom creator Chris Sievey Read More Man accused of having pipe bomb in his luggage at Manchester Airport appears in court 
Harry’s father Chris Sievey died from cancer in 2010 and a bronze statue of his famous Frank Sidebottom character now stands in Timperley village in his memory. 
At the time Harry told the M.E.N. his dad had ‘really put the little town of Timperley on the map’, adding: “Now he’s gone it would be nice to have something still there that recognises that.” 
Any witnesses or anyone with information should call the Serious Collision Investigation Unit on 0161 856 4741 or Crimestoppers, anonymously, on 0800 555 111. Like us on Facebook
